intro: Cinnagrostis breviaristata, commonly known as the short-bracted cinnagrostis, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and has narrow, grass-like leaves. Its small, yellow flowers bloom in late summer, and it is often found in moist or wet habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
